      • arrangeNeurons

        public boolean arrangeNeurons()
        Arranges the output neurons of the net according to the topology, i.e., the positions of neurons are set and the neurons get an ID, which can be used to identify its position in the map. The horizontal distances of neurons are 1. Each second row (starting with row 1) is offset with 0.5 to the right, which reflects the hexagonal structure. Note that for neighborhood calculations the distance of neighboring neurons is always 1, i.e., the six hexagonal neighbors of a neuron all have distance 1.
        Specified by:
        arrangeNeurons in class Topology
        Returns:
        true, if arranged, false, if the number of output neurons does not match the map size

      • setMapValue

      • clearMap

        Clears the map (set to EMPTY).
        Specified by:

      • searchNeighbors

        protected void searchNeighbors(int id,
                               int radius)
        Searches direct hexagonal neighbors of the given center neuron. The distance of the neighbors of the start neuron is entered in the map at the corresponding neuron position. The start neuron has a distance of 0. The first neighbors a distance of 1, etc. All unchecked neuron map positions have a distance of EMPTY(-1). If the center neuron has a distance of the given radius, it is a border neuron, so search is stopped.
        Specified by:
        searchNeighbors in class Topology
        Parameters:
        id - the center neuron index
        radius - the neighborhood radius
